{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Threshold Glue and Decision-Rate Restarts",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if (fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 1.5) OR (decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 × historical_max_decision_rate_ewma) AND stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Track historical_max_decision_rate_ewma as the peak observed value.",
    "Check if (fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 1.5) OR (decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 × historical_max_decision_rate_ewma).",
    "Only trigger restart if stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If both conditions are true, trigger restart immediately."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire, restart immediately.",
    "If neither fires, defer restart until at least one does.",
    "If stats.conflicts < restart_conflict_limit, never restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMA difference and decision-rate drop captures both search stagnation and poor learnt clause quality, leading to timely restarts and reduced wasted effort."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-EWMA Adaptive Glucose Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart if (fast_glue_ewma > 1.10 * slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.90 * prev_decision_rate_ewma) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit. prev_decision_rate_ewma is the decision_rate_ewma at the last restart.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "After each conflict, evaluate the scoring function.",
    "If the function triggers, perform a restart and update prev_decision_rate_ewma.",
    "If both conditions trigger simultaneously, prioritize the glue-based condition.",
    "If neither triggers, continue search without restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both glue and conflict-limit conditions trigger, apply the glue-based restart first.",
    "If fast_glue_ewma equals 1.10 * slow_glue_ewma, do not restart until it strictly exceeds.",
    "If decision_rate_ewma equals 0.90 * prev_decision_rate_ewma, do not restart until it strictly drops below."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining fast/slow glue EWMAs detects search stagnation, while a drop in decision rate signals slow progress. This adaptive, low-cost policy triggers early restarts in hard regions, maximizing solved instances and optimizing PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Hybrid Glue-Rate Adaptive Restarts",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger restart when (fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 * slow_glue_ewma) AND (decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 * historical_decision_rate) AND (stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit). historical_decision_rate is the slowest decision_rate_ewma observed in the current stable/unstable phase.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Track historical_decision_rate as the minimum decision_rate_ewma in the current stable/unstable phase.",
    "Check if fast_glue_ewma exceeds 1.2 times slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma is less than 0.8 times historical_decision_rate.",
    "If both above and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart.",
    "After restart, reset historical_decision_rate for the new phase."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple restarts are eligible in the same conflict, trigger only one restart.",
    "If both stable and unstable phases are eligible, prioritize the phase with higher fast_glue_ewma."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue disparity and dropping decision rate detects stagnation. This hybrid policy adapts to instance structure, avoids premature restarts, and promotes progress, improving solved count and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Rate Hybrid Restart Policy",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger restart when (fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 * slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 * baseline_rate) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit. baseline_rate is the initial decision_rate_ewma at phase start.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, compare fast_glue_ewma to 1.2 × slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma is below 0.8 × baseline_rate for current phase.",
    "If both conditions hold, trigger a restart.",
    "If stats.conflicts reaches restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart.",
    "After restart, update baseline_rate to current decision_rate_ewma."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both glue-rate and conflict-limit triggers fire simultaneously, prefer glue-rate trigger.",
    "If equality holds in threshold checks, treat as trigger firing.",
    "If multiple restarts are possible in a single check, perform only one restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMA disparity with declining decision rate captures both stagnation and search inefficiency, adapting restart timing to solver dynamics for improved performance."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Drop with Decision Rate Guard",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger a restart if (fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 1.0) AND (decision_rate_ewma < 0.95 × decision_rate_ewma at last restart), OR if stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, compute if (fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 1.0).",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma < 0.95 × decision_rate_ewma at last restart.",
    "If both above hold, fire a restart.",
    "Else, if stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit, fire a restart.",
    "After restart, record current decision_rate_ewma as baseline for next interval.",
    "Never restart if level = 0."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire, prefer the glue/decision-rate trigger.",
    "If stable is true, increment restart_conflict_limit by 50% after each restart.",
    "If stable is false, halve restart_conflict_limit after each restart.",
    "If multiple restarts would fire simultaneously, fire only one."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue spikes with decision rate drops targets stagnation and local minima. Adaptive limits balance agility and overhead, improving PAR-2 and solved instances."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dynamic Glue-Rate Adaptive Restarts (DGAR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Compute S = (fast_glue_ewma / slow_glue_ewma) * (1 / decision_rate_ewma). Trigger a restart if S > 1.2 and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update S using the latest signal values.",
    "Check if stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If S > 1.2 and conflict limit reached, trigger a restart immediately.",
    "If not, continue without restarting.",
    "After restart, reset restart_conflict_limit as per Kissat's internal policy."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If S equals 1.2, do not restart.",
    "If multiple restarts are possible, trigger only one per conflict.",
    "If stable is true, increase restart_conflict_limit by 20% after restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining local glue quality and decision rate, this policy adapts to phases of slow progress. It triggers restarts only when both local conflict quality degrades and the solver is making fewer decisions, avoiding premature or excessive restarts. This balances search diversification and focus, maximizing solved instances and improving PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Threshold Adaptive Glue/Decision-Rate Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger restart when either: (A) fast_glue_ewma > 0.9 × slow_glue_ewma and level ≥ 5, or (B) decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 × average_decision_rate_ewma (computed per stable/unstable) and stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "Update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma after each conflict.",
    "If stable is true, use stable EWMAs; else, use unstable EWMAs for all thresholds.",
    "If (A) or (B) is met, trigger a restart immediately.",
    "If both (A) and (B) are met, prefer the criterion with the higher absolute deviation from its threshold.",
    "After restart, reset average_decision_rate_ewma for the current phase."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both (A) and (B) would trigger, select the one with the larger relative threshold violation.",
    "If equal, prefer (A) glue-based trigger.",
    "If still equal, break ties by triggering at the lower stats.conflicts value.",
    "If still equal, prefer the stable phase.",
    "Otherwise, default to no restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue-based stagnation (local search inefficiency) with low decision rates (search slowdown) enables responsive, phase-aware restarts. Dual thresholds adapt to instance behavior, maximizing solved instances and minimizing PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Threshold Adaptive Glue-Rate Restart (DTAGR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if (fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 2) OR (decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 × median_decision_rate_ewma) AND stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit. The median_decision_rate_ewma is maintained as a running median over the last 1000 conflicts.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Maintain a running median of decision_rate_ewma for the last 1000 conflicts.",
    "If fast_glue_ewma exceeds slow_glue_ewma by more than 2, set restart_trigger = true.",
    "If decision_rate_ewma falls below 75% of the running median, set restart_trigger = true.",
    "If restart_trigger is true and stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit, perform restart.",
    "After restart, reset restart_trigger and update restart_conflict_limit."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both glue and decision-rate triggers fire, prioritize glue-based trigger.",
    "If stats.conflicts equals restart_conflict_limit exactly, always restart.",
    "If multiple triggers fire simultaneously, increment restart_conflict_limit by 10% after restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue-based and adaptive decision-rate triggers leverages both local search stagnation and global progress slowdown. This dual adaptive approach enables early restarts under stagnation or slow progress, improving coverage and reducing heavy-tailed runtime, thus maximizing solved instances and lowering PAR-2. Median-based adaptation ensures robustness to noise and phase changes."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Threshold Glue-Rate Restart (ADGRR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart when either (1) fast_glue_ewma exceeds slow_glue_ewma by at least 3.5, or (2) decision_rate_ewma drops below half its moving average over the last restart interval. Additionally, enforce a hard restart at restart_conflict_limit conflicts.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, compare fast_glue_ewma and slow_glue_ewma; if fast_glue_ewma >= slow_glue_ewma + 3.5, trigger restart.",
    "Monitor decision_rate_ewma; if it falls below 50% of its average since last restart, trigger restart.",
    "If stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger restart.",
    "Restart only if level > 0 to avoid trivial restarts.",
    "If multiple triggers occur simultaneously, select the earliest to fire."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both glue and decision rate triggers fire, prioritize the glue-based trigger.",
    "If trigger conditions are met simultaneously at the same conflict, restart immediately.",
    "If level is zero, defer restart until next eligible conflict."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue disparity and decision rate drop dynamically detects stagnation and poor learnt clause quality, prompting timely restarts. Dual thresholds adapt to both local and global search behavior, maximizing solved instances and minimizing PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Drop Decision Rate Restart (AGDDR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart when (fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma) AND (decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 * historical_max_decision_rate) AND (stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit). Maintain historical_max_decision_rate as the highest observed decision_rate_ewma.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update historical_max_decision_rate if decision_rate_ewma exceeds it.",
    "Check if fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 * historical_max_decision_rate.",
    "Check if stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If all checks pass, trigger a restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple restarts are possible, prefer the one with higher fast_glue_ewma.",
    "If tie persists, prefer when decision_rate_ewma is lowest.",
    "If still tied, prefer lower stats.conflicts."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue stagnation and decision slowdown signals stagnation. This adaptive policy triggers restarts only when both learning quality and search speed degrade, improving performance and robustness."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Rate Hybrid Restart Policy",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Compute S = fast_glue_ewma / slow_glue_ewma. Compute D = decision_rate_ewma. Trigger a restart if (S > 1.2 AND D < 0.6 * avg(D)) OR if stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit. avg(D) is the running mean of decision_rate_ewma since last restart.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update running mean avg(D) of decision_rate_ewma since last restart.",
    "Compute S = fast_glue_ewma / slow_glue_ewma.",
    "If S > 1.2 and decision_rate_ewma < 0.6 * avg(D), trigger a restart.",
    "Else if stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart.",
    "If stable is false, halve 0.6 threshold to 0.3 for more aggressive restarts."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both conditions trigger, prioritize glue-based trigger.",
    "If S exactly 1.2, do not trigger restart unless conflict limit reached.",
    "If avg(D) is undefined (first restart), use D threshold of 0.6 directly."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining fast/slow glue ratios with adaptive decision rate separates stagnation from progress. This policy ensures early restarts on local stagnation, while fallback to conflict limits guarantees progress. Adaptivity to stable mode and parameterization improves both solved instances and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Glue Decision Rate Restart (ADDRR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger a restart if (fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma) and (decision_rate_ewma < 0.85 * historical_peak_decision_rate_ewma) and (stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit).",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "On each conflict, update EWMA signals and check the scoring function.",
    "If both glue and decision rate conditions are true and conflict limit reached, restart fires.",
    "If only one condition is met, delay restart until both are met or restart_conflict_limit is exceeded by 20%.",
    "After any restart, reset historical_peak_decision_rate_ewma if a new peak is observed.",
    "If in stable mode, double restart_conflict_limit to prefer longer phases."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple restarts could fire simultaneously, prefer the one with higher level.",
    "If still tied, prefer the earliest stats.conflicts.",
    "If still tied, fire restart only if stable is false."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMAs with decision rate adaptively detects when search stagnates or explores poorly. This policy balances aggressiveness and patience, maximizing solved instances and minimizing wasted effort."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dynamic Glue-Rate Adaptive Restart (DGAR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart if (fast_glue_ewma > 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 * historical_max_decision_rate_ewma) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "After each conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Track historical_max_decision_rate_ewma as the maximum observed value so far.",
    "If restart_conflict_limit is reached, fire restart immediately.",
    "Otherwise, if fast_glue_ewma > 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma and decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 * historical_max_decision_rate_ewma, trigger a restart.",
    "Reset historical_max_decision_rate_ewma after each restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers activate simultaneously, prioritize the conflict limit restart.",
    "If in stable mode (stable==true), apply the same logic; no further tie-break needed.",
    "If restarts are tied by all criteria, restart at the next conflict."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue-based stagnation and decision rate drop detects when search is unproductive or stuck. Fast response to these signals prevents wasted computation, improving solved instances and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Rate Threshold Restarts",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart when (fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 * slow_glue_ewma) and (decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 * mean_decision_rate) and (stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit). mean_decision_rate is the EWMA of decision_rate_ewma since last restart.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "On each conflict, update mean_decision_rate (EWMA) if stats.conflicts > last_restart_conflicts.",
    "Check if stable is false; if true, skip restart checks.",
    "If (fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 * slow_glue_ewma) and (decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 * mean_decision_rate), proceed.",
    "If stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger restart.",
    "After restart, reset mean_decision_rate and last_restart_conflicts."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both glue and decision-rate thresholds are equal, restart if level > 8.",
    "If stable, defer all restarts until unstable.",
    "If multiple criteria are simultaneously met, prioritize lower decision_rate_ewma."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining fast-vs-slow glue and decision rate signals adapts to stagnation and hard phases. This targets unproductive search zones, reducing wasted computation and improving PAR-2 and robustness."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Glue and Decision Rate Restart Policy",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either (1) fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 1.5, or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 × max_decision_rate_ewma_observed, and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "Update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma after each conflict.",
    "Track max_decision_rate_ewma_observed as the maximum seen so far in the current phase.",
    "If stable is true, apply the scoring function; if false, skip restart.",
    "If scoring function is satisfied and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger restart.",
    "After restart, reset max_decision_rate_ewma_observed to current decision_rate_ewma."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both conditions are true, trigger restart immediately.",
    "If neither condition is true but restart_conflict_limit is reached, defer restart until a trigger fires.",
    "If glue values are equal, prefer decision_rate_ewma criterion."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue divergence and decision stagnation captures both search stagnation and poor clause learning. Dynamically adapts to instance behavior, maximizing solved instances and minimizing wasted effort."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Threshold Adaptive Glue-Decision Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either (fast_glue_ewma > 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma and decision_rate_ewma < prev_decision_rate_ewma) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit. prev_decision_rate_ewma is the previous value of decision_rate_ewma, updated after each restart.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "On each conflict, evaluate if fast_glue_ewma > 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma < prev_decision_rate_ewma.",
    "If both above are true, trigger a restart.",
    "If stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart.",
    "After a restart, set prev_decision_rate_ewma = decision_rate_ewma."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both conditions trigger simultaneously, prefer the earliest one based on signal evaluation order.",
    "If stable is true, require both glue and decision-rate conditions to trigger a restart.",
    "If level < 2, suppress restart to avoid trivial restarts."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue and decision-rate trends targets slow progress phases. Dual thresholds adapt to instance phase, reducing useless restarts while ensuring agility. O(1) updates ensure efficiency."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dynamic Glue-Rate Adaptive Restart (DGAR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart if (fast_glue_ewma > 1.15 * slow_glue_ewma) AND (decision_rate_ewma < 0.98 * previous_decision_rate_ewma) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "On every conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Compare fast_glue_ewma to slow_glue_ewma; compute their ratio.",
    "Compare current decision_rate_ewma to its previous value.",
    "If both the glue ratio and decision rate drop conditions are met, trigger a restart.",
    "If stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart regardless of other signals."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire simultaneously, restart immediately.",
    "If only one fires, prefer glue-based trigger over conflict limit.",
    "If at level 0, do not restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue inflation and decision slowdown detects stagnation, promoting early restarts when progress stalls but avoids unnecessary restarts during sustained progress. This adapts to instance hardness, balancing rapid learning with exploration, maximizing solved instances and minimizing PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dynamic Glue-Rate Adaptive Restart (DGAR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Compute S = (fast_glue_ewma / slow_glue_ewma) + (decision_rate_ewma / max(1, level)); trigger restart if S < 1.05 and stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Calculate S as defined in the scoring function.",
    "If S < 1.05 and stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart.",
    "If not, continue without restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If S equals 1.05, trigger restart only if stable is false.",
    "If multiple restarts are possible in the same conflict, perform only one.",
    "If level is zero, do not restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMAs and decision rate captures both learned clause quality and search efficiency. The adaptive threshold ensures restarts when progress stalls, improving solved count and PAR-2 by avoiding stagnation."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Threshold Glue & Decision Rate Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered when (fast_glue_ewma > 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma) AND (decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 * max_decision_rate_ewma_seen) AND (stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit).",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, update fast_glue_ewma, slow_glue_ewma, and decision_rate_ewma.",
    "Maintain max_decision_rate_ewma_seen as the highest observed decision_rate_ewma.",
    "If all trigger conditions in the scoring function are satisfied, schedule a restart.",
    "After a restart, reset restart_conflict_limit as per solver defaults."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple restarts are possible in the same conflict, prioritize the earliest trigger.",
    "If trigger thresholds are met simultaneously due to update order, use the glue-based condition first.",
    "If stable is false, defer restart by one conflict to avoid oscillation."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue stagnation and decision rate decay detects when search becomes unproductive. Dual-thresholding avoids premature restarts and adapts to instance hardness, enhancing both solved instances and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Threshold Adaptive Glue & Decision Rate Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either (1) fast_glue_ewma > 1.1 * slow_glue_ewma and level > 0, or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.85 * its initial value and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit. The policy is only active when stable == false.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "If stable is true, do not consider restart (defer to standard policy).",
    "If fast_glue_ewma > 1.1 * slow_glue_ewma and level > 0, trigger restart.",
    "Else if decision_rate_ewma < 0.85 * initial_decision_rate_ewma and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger restart.",
    "Otherwise, do not restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both conditions trigger simultaneously, prioritize glue-based restart.",
    "If level == 0, do not restart regardless of other signals."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue divergence (conflict quality worsens) and decision stagnation (progress slows) allows fast response to hard phases while avoiding unnecessary restarts. This balances exploration and exploitation, improving solved instances and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Glue and Decision Rate Adaptive Fast-Slow Hybrid Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart fires if: (fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 * initial_decision_rate) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit; initial_decision_rate is the decision_rate_ewma at the beginning of the search or after the last restart.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, compute fast_glue_ewma and slow_glue_ewma for the current stable phase.",
    "Check if fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Simultaneously, check if decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 * initial_decision_rate.",
    "If both (2) and (3) are true, trigger a restart immediately.",
    "If not, trigger a restart when stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "After restart, reset initial_decision_rate to current decision_rate_ewma."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire simultaneously, prioritize the glue/decision rate trigger.",
    "If both stable and unstable phases meet the trigger, restart regardless of phase.",
    "If initial_decision_rate is undefined (start of search), use only conflict limit."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining fast/slow glue and decision rate captures both search stagnation and local minima. Adaptive thresholding ensures flexibility across instance types. The O(1) checks leverage existing EWMA signals for efficient, responsive restarts, improving solved count and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Threshold Glue & Decision Rate Restarts",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either (1) fast_glue_ewma >= 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma and level > 0, or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 * (stats.decisions / stats.conflicts) and level > 0. Both conditions checked at each conflict. Conflicts since last restart must exceed restart_conflict_limit.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, evaluate: is fast_glue_ewma >= 0.9 * slow_glue_ewma and level > 0?",
    "If not, check: is decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 * (stats.decisions / stats.conflicts) and level > 0?",
    "Confirm stats.conflicts since last restart >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If any above conditions hold, trigger a restart.",
    "If both glue and decision rate triggers fire, prioritize glue trigger."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers are satisfied, restart due to glue (prioritize structural stagnation).",
    "If both triggers fire and stable is true, halve restart_conflict_limit for next interval.",
    "If both triggers fire and stable is false, double restart_conflict_limit for next interval."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue and decision rate adaptively detects both clause learning stagnation and search inefficiency. Dual thresholds allow prompt reaction to hard-to-solve regions, maximizing solved instances and minimizing wasted search, while dynamic intervals adjust to instance hardness."
}

{
"Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Decision Hybrid Restarts",
"Scoring Function Definition": "Restart fires if (fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 × slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.95 × previous_decision_rate_ewma) OR stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
"Selection Procedure": [

  "Scoring Function Definition": "Define score S = (fast_glue_ewma - slow_glue_ewma) + alpha * (decision_rate_ewma - beta); trigger restart if S < 0 or stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, where alpha, beta are tunable constants.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, compute S using current EWMAs and constants alpha, beta.",
    "If S < 0, trigger a restart immediately.",
    "If stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, trigger a restart.",
    "After restart, reset stats.conflicts to 0 and update restart_conflict_limit as per solver defaults."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both S < 0 and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, prioritize S < 0 restart.",
    "If multiple restarts would be triggered simultaneously, execute only one restart per conflict.",
    "If S equals 0, do not restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMAs with decision rate adapts to both search stagnation and fast progress. Frequent restarts occur when glue quality and decision rate degrade, while stable progress delays restarts. This hybrid maximizes solved instances and reduces wasted search."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Glue-Decision Hybrid Restarts",

    "If true, trigger a restart immediately.",
    "Else, restart when stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "Reset conflict count and last_decision_rate_ewma after each restart."

    "If stable is true, require a 1.3 factor instead of 1.2 for glue ratio.",
    "If both glue and decision triggers are exactly equal to thresholds, restart.",
    "If restart_conflict_limit is reached before other triggers, restart.",
    "If level is zero, do not restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue and decision-rate EWMA detects both local search stagnation and global slowdowns. This adaptivity allows faster progress on both easy and hard instances, improving overall PAR-2 and solved count."
}

{

  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either: (1) fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma, or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 * its initial value, and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",

  "Tie-breaking Rules": [

  "Reason": "Combining glue stagnation and decision slowdown enables prompt restarts when search progress stalls. This adaptivity balances between fast exploration and depth, maximizing solved instances and reducing PAR-2."

{

  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either: (1) fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 × slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.8 × global_decision_rate_ewma; OR (2) stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit. global_decision_rate_ewma is a long-term average updated in O(1).",

    "If neither, continue search without restart."

  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire simultaneously, perform the restart immediately.",

    "If level is zero, delay restart until next non-zero level.",

  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMA separation and decision rate drop captures both local search stagnation and global slowdown. This double threshold adaptively restarts when progress falters, maximizing solved instances and PAR-2."

  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart if either: (A) fast_glue_ewma > 1.05 × slow_glue_ewma and level ≥ 8, or (B) decision_rate_ewma < 0.85 × its initial value. In either case, stats.conflicts must exceed restart_conflict_limit.",

    "Reset restart_conflict_limit upon each restart.",
    "Initial decision_rate_ewma is set at solver start and kept constant for comparison."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both (A) and (B) trigger, restart immediately.",
    "If only one triggers, restart only if level ≥ 8.",
    "If level < 8, do not restart regardless of the scoring function.",
    "If multiple restarts are possible in one step, perform only one."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combines glue surge with decision stagnation to detect local search stagnation and community shifts, triggering timely restarts to diversify search and reduce PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Threshold Glue-Rate Restart Policy",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either: (1) fast_glue_ewma > slow_glue_ewma + 1.5 and level > 2; or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.85 × its slow EWMA over last 64 conflicts. Additionally, enforce a hard limit: stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",

    "If none of the above, do not restart."

  "Tie-breaking Rules": [

    "If both glue and decision-rate triggers fire, prioritize glue.",

    "If all else equal, defer restart one conflict."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue and decision rate captures both search stagnation and slowdown. Dual thresholds adapt to instance dynamics, balancing rapid progress and avoiding premature restarts. This maximizes solved instances and PAR-2 by enabling timely restarts only when search quality degrades."
}

{

    "After each restart, update baseline_rate to current decision_rate_ewma."

  "Reason": "Combining glue-based stagnation with decision rate drops detects both stagnation and search inefficiency, adapting restarts to instance behavior. This balances early and late restarts, improving instance coverage and PAR-2."

    "Otherwise, do not restart."

    "If stable is true, require decision_rate_ewma < 0.90 * average_decision_rate to trigger glue-based restart.",
    "If level <= 1, never trigger a restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMAs and decision rate captures both local difficulty and search stagnation. This double-threshold policy adaptively restarts early when progress slows, maximizing solved instances and reducing wasted conflicts."
}

{

  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if either: (1) fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 × slow_glue_ewma and stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit; or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.5 × its initial value and level > 0.",

    "If both conditions are true, prefer the fast_glue-based trigger."

  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire, act on the fast_glue_ewma condition first.",
    "If restart_conflict_limit is not yet reached, do not restart.",

  "Reason": "Combining relative GLUE stagnation with drops in decision rate adapts to both search stagnation and rapid progress periods. Dual triggers enable fast escapes from fruitless regions, maximizing solved instances and reducing heavy PAR-2 penalties by balancing aggressive and conservative restarts based on real-time search dynamics."
}

{

    "If both glue and rate conditions hold, trigger a restart.",
    "Else, do not restart.",
    "Update median_decision_rate every 1000 conflicts with the latest batch of decision_rate_ewma values."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both scoring triggers fire simultaneously, prefer the restart_conflict_limit trigger.",
    "If decision_rate_ewma equals exactly 0.75 * median_decision_rate, trigger restart.",
    "If glue measurements are equal, skip restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue EWMA and decision rate detects stagnation and heavy backtracking, adapting to instance phase. This dual-trigger policy balances aggressive and conservative restarts, maximizing solved instances and minimizing wasted search."
}

{

    "Ensure stats.conflicts has reached restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If all above, trigger restart; else, continue search."

  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple triggers overlap, fire restart at earliest stats.conflicts.",
    "If level == 0, delay restart until level > 0.",
    "If stable switches during evaluation, re-evaluate at next conflict."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue stagnation and declining decision rate adapts to both local search inefficiency and global progress slowdown, improving solved instances and PAR-2."
}

{

  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart when (fast_glue_ewma - slow_glue_ewma) > θ AND decision_rate_ewma drops by ≥ δ% since last restart, OR when stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit. θ and δ are tunable thresholds (e.g., θ=3, δ=20).",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "After each conflict, compute diff = fast_glue_ewma - slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Check if diff > θ; if not, do not restart.",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma has dropped by δ% or more since last restart.",
    "If both conditions met, trigger a restart.",
    "Regardless, trigger restart if stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If none apply, continue search without restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire, prefer the glue/decision-rate trigger over conflict-limit.",
    "If θ or δ thresholds are exactly met, trigger restart.",
    "If stable is true, increment θ by 1 to delay restarts."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue slope and decision rate detects stagnation more sensitively than fixed limits. This adapts to local search dynamics, reducing wasted work and improving solved instances and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Adaptive Dual-Threshold Glue-Decision Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "A restart is triggered if (fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 * recent_decision_rate_min) OR stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit. Here, recent_decision_rate_min tracks the minimum decision_rate_ewma over the last 1000 conflicts.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "After each conflict, update recent_decision_rate_min if decision_rate_ewma is lower.",
    "Check if fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Check if decision_rate_ewma < 0.75 * recent_decision_rate_min.",
    "If both 2 and 3 are true, trigger restart.",
    "Always trigger restart if stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple triggers fire, prioritize stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If stable is true, halve the effect of glue thresholds before evaluating triggers.",
    "On equal scores, favor earlier restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue convergence and decision slowdown identifies stagnation early. Dynamic thresholds adapt to instance behavior, increasing solved count and PAR-2 performance. O(1) updates satisfy efficiency."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Glue Adaptive Decision-Rate Restart Policy",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart when either: (1) fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma and level > 1, or (2) decision_rate_ewma < 0.7 * its long-term average. Both conditions checked at each conflict; restart_conflict_limit is always enforced.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, compute the ratio fast_glue_ewma / slow_glue_ewma and compare decision_rate_ewma to its long-term average.",
    "If fast_glue_ewma exceeds 95% of slow_glue_ewma and level > 1, trigger a restart.",
    "If decision_rate_ewma drops below 70% of its long-term average, trigger a restart.",
    "If neither condition is met, do not restart unless stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "Upon simultaneous triggers, prioritize glue-ratio-based restart.",
    "Reset relevant counters/averages after each restart."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If both triggers fire, restart due to glue ratio.",
    "If both ratios are exactly at threshold, use the lower ratio.",
    "If stable is true, require both triggers to fire for restart.",
    "If level == 1, never restart.",
    "If restart_conflict_limit is reached, always restart regardless of other conditions."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue-based and decision-rate signals captures both clause quality stagnation and search slowdown. Adaptive thresholds and dual triggers allow timely, targeted restarts, improving instance coverage and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Glue Dynamic Restart with Decision Rate Backoff",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger a restart if: (fast_glue_ewma > 1.05 × slow_glue_ewma) AND (decision_rate_ewma < 0.98 × average_decision_rate_so_far) AND (stats.conflicts ≥ restart_conflict_limit).",
  "Selection Procedure": [

    "If the scoring function is satisfied, trigger a restart.",
    "After restart, update average_decision_rate_so_far with the new stats."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If multiple restarts are triggered simultaneously, prioritize the earliest stats.conflicts value.",
    "If stable is true, halve the restart_conflict_limit to favor more frequent restarts.",
    "If level is 0, suppress the restart."
  ],
  "Reason": "Combining glue-based stagnation detection with decision rate slowdown flags hard search regions. This adaptive, O(1) policy encourages restarts when progress stalls, improving overall solving and PAR-2."
}

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-Threshold Adaptive Glue-Rate Restart",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Restart is triggered if (fast_glue_ewma > 1.2 × slow_glue_ewma AND decision_rate_ewma < 0.95 × long-term average) OR stats.conflicts reaches restart_conflict_limit.",

    "If stats.conflicts equals restart_conflict_limit, trigger restart regardless.",

    "If neither fires, do not restart.",

{

  "Scoring Function Definition": "Trigger a restart if either: (A) fast_glue_ewma > 0.95 * slow_glue_ewma and level > 1, or (B) decision_rate_ewma < 0.85 times its value at last restart. Additionally, do not restart before reaching restart_conflict_limit conflicts since last restart.",

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Dual-GLUE Adaptive Restart (DGAR)",

  "Selection Procedure": [

  "Tie-breaking Rules": [

  "Reason": "By monitoring the convergence of fast and slow GLUE EWMAs, DGAR detects stagnation. Adaptive thresholds balance aggressive and conservative restarts, improving solved instances and PAR-2."

{
  "Algorithm Name": "Glue-Divergence Adaptive Restart (GDAR)",
  "Scoring Function Definition": "Compute D = fast_glue_ewma - slow_glue_ewma. Trigger a restart if D > T and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit, where T = 1.0 + 0.2 * stable.",
  "Selection Procedure": [
    "At each conflict, calculate D = fast_glue_ewma - slow_glue_ewma.",
    "Set threshold T = 1.0 + 0.2 * stable (T=1.0 if unstable, T=1.2 if stable).",
    "Check if D > T and stats.conflicts >= restart_conflict_limit.",
    "If yes, trigger a restart; else, continue search."
  ],
  "Tie-breaking Rules": [
    "If D equals T, trigger a restart only if level > 1.",
    "If multiple restarts are possible in the same conflict, pick the earliest by stats.conflicts."
  ],
  "Reason": "GDAR exploits the gap between recent and long-term glue quality to detect stagnation. Adaptive thresholds reduce unnecessary restarts in stable phases, maximizing solved instances and minimizing PAR-2."
}
